title: Chicago 21 (XXI)
description:
Here&#039;s a great formula -- take a really really successful band who turns out five really really successful albums, and on their twenty-first outing challenge everything they want to do, back them with no advertising, and watch the money roll in.

These are the morons who run the record industry.  Fact is, Chicago 21 has about three or four hits on it but not so as you&#039;d be able to tell.  The album disappeared the moment it left the door -- if I hadn&#039;t have had a sober moment my last year of college I would have missed it.  How hard is this album to find?  Used copies sell for around $10 on EBay.  That&#039;s not too bad and indicates it&#039;s pretty rare, since you can pick up a copy of 20 for 1 cent.



The album contains:


Explain It To My Heart

If It Were You

You Come To My Senses

Somebody, Somewhere

What Does It Take

One From the Heart

Chasin&#039; the Wind

God Save the Queen

Man to Woman

Only Time Can Heal the Wounded

Who Do You Love

Holdin&#039; On



VOTE CHICAGO INTO THE HALL OF FAME!
